questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Delta Lake's transaction log (_delta_log)?
options: Track every change made to the table for ACID guarantees
Cache query results for faster reads
questions.explanation: The _delta_log directory contains JSON files that track every transaction (write, update, delete) made to the table. This is the foundation of Delta Lake's ACID compliance and time travel capabilities.

questions.question: What open-source file format does Delta Lake use to store the actual data?
questions.explanation: Delta Lake uses Parquet as its underlying data format. Parquet is a columnar storage format optimized for analytics workloads with excellent compression and encoding support.

questions.question: What happens when a checkpoint file is created in the transaction log?
options: All data files are backed up
A snapshot of the table state is saved in Parquet format for faster reads
The table is locked for maintenance
questions.explanation: Checkpoints are created periodically (default: every 10 commits) to consolidate the transaction log into a single Parquet file. This enables faster table state reconstruction without reading all JSON log files.

questions.question: Which feature allows Delta Lake to 'undo' a bad write by reading a previous table version?
questions.explanation: Time Travel leverages the transaction log to reconstruct any previous table state. You can query historical data using VERSION AS OF or TIMESTAMP AS OF syntax, or RESTORE a table to a prior version.

questions.question: Delta Lake was originally created at which company before becoming open-source?
questions.explanation: Delta Lake was created by Databricks and open-sourced in 2019. It was accepted into the Linux Foundation in 2021, making it a vendor-neutral open standard for lakehouse storage.
